title: Alternative Energy Vehicles
description: Multidisciplinary investigation of automotive renewable fuels and electric/hybrid vehicles. Analysis and design of related technologies and systems. Methods for complete-cycle energy and GHG analysis. Comparative emissions, efficiency, power output, and production, distribution and storage infrastructure requirements. May require some supplemental self-study. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: Junior standing; Engineering majors, Bioresource and Agricultural Engineering majors, Chemistry or Physics majors; completion of GE Areas B1 and B3
